DataElement.preferredName: Patient Excision Imaging Technique Performed Clinical Trials Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial regarding A person who receives surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ. and tests that produce pictures of areas inside the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Excision Imaging Technique Performed Clinical Trials Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial regarding A person who receives surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ. and tests that produce pictures of areas inside the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Excision Imaging Technique Performed Clinical Trials Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ. :Tests that produce pictures of areas inside the body.:Performed; carried out.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
